title: Philadelphia shooting suspect isn't trans, officials say, but speculation continues
description: Less than 24 hours after Monday’s mass shooting in Philadelphia, right-wing pockets of social media were exploding with speculation about the suspect identifying as transgender.

title: Russian jets harassed American drones that were targeting ISIS, U.S. says
description: Russian jets harassed U.S. hunter-killer drones that were conducting a mission against ISIS targets in Syria on Wednesday, a U.S. commanding officer said.

title: Instagram and Meta launch new app to rival Twitter
description: Instagram and its parent company Meta launched Threads, a new app to rival Twitter, tonight. NBC News’ Erin McLaughlin has more on the growing social media feud between billionaires Mark Zuckerberg and Elon Musk.

title: A high BMI is not necessarily associated with a higher risk of death, study finds
description: A body mass index in the range considered overweight is not necessarily associated with a higher risk of death, a new study has found.

title: These tenants fought one of America's largest corporate landlords — and scored some wins
description: A group of Minneapolis tenants has won rent freezes, refunds and other concessions from private-equity-backed Progress Residential, a major corporate landlord.

title: What you need to know about Threads, Instagram’s new Twitter competitor
description: Instagram’s Threads app, a text-based social media platform poised to become Twitter’s latest competitor, is now available to users in more than 100 countries.

title: Iowa's GOP governor calls a special session to push abortion restrictions
description: Iowa Gov. Kim Reynolds called Wednesday for a special legislative session that she said would be dedicated exclusively to enacting “pro-life legislation.”

title: Man sentenced to life in prison for rape of 10-year-old
description: The man charged with raping a 10-year-old girl who traveled to Indiana for an abortion pleaded guilty to a charge of rape Wednesday and was immediately sentenced to life in prison.

title: Judge orders release of more Mar-a-Lago search warrant information in Trump classified docs case
description: A judge ordered more information from the search warrant affidavit in the FBI discovery of classified documents at Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago be made public.

title: A day ahead of launch, public gets a glance at Instagram's new Twitter competitor
description: Meta plans to launch Threads, its much-anticipated rival to Twitter, just days after Twitter began instituting limits on how many tweets a person can see.

title: U.S. Navy says it stopped Iran from trying to seize two tankers
description: The U.S. Navy stopped Iranian warships from seizing two oil tankers in international waters near Oman on Wednesday, according to a U.S. military official.

title: Lab test confirms white substance found at the White House is cocaine
description: A lab test of the white substance found at the White House on Sunday confirmed it was positive for cocaine, a source said.

title: Ukraine and Russia warn of imminent attacks on Europe's biggest nuclear plant. Should the world worry?
description: Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant is at risk of being blown up, presidents Volodymyr Zelenskyy and Vladimir Putin claim. How dangerous would that be?

title: How to sign up for Threads, Meta’s new Twitter competitor
description: Meta will officially release Threads, its text-based Twitter competitor, on Thursday, but for those who want to get ahead of the launch, there’s a way to access your invitation now.

title: Barriers to transgender health care lead some to embrace a do-it-yourself approach
description: More transgender people may choose a DIY approach to gender-transition care due to the political environment and transgender health ban.

title: In NYC, companies will have to prove their AI hiring software isn't sexist or racist
description: New York City businesses that use artificial intelligence to help find hires now have to show the process was free from sexism and racism.

title: Meta’s new Threads app ignites social media war with Twitter
description: Mark Zuckerberg’s Meta is taking on Twitter with the launch of Threads, a direct competitor to the social platform. Elon Musk, meanwhile, is making more controversial changes to Twitter. NBC’s Erin McLaughlin reports for TODAY.

title: Jenny Craig will be revived for e-commerce by the owner of diet meal maker Nutrisystem
description: Wellful Inc. plans to relaunch the defunct weight-loss service this fall, with virtual rather than in-person coaching, after acquiring its brand assets out of bankruptcy.

title: Macy's 2023 Fourth of July Fireworks light up New York City sky
description: Fourth of July celebrations culminated with spectacular shows from coast-to-coast including the 47th annual Macy’s Fourth of July Fireworks and the debut of the MSG Sphere in Las Vegas illuminating the night sky with the largest LED screen on the planet.

title: At least 9 people, including child and teen, injured in D.C. shooting during Fourth of July celebrations
description: At least nine people, including a child and a teenager, were injured in a shooting in the nation's capital early Wednesday during Fourth of July celebrations, police said.

title: In this beach town, sometimes the first cop on the scene is a drone
description: When someone calls 911 for police in the upscale beach town of Santa Monica, California, a drone is dispatched from the station's roof with a push of a button.

title: How the Steel City became a vanguard of the progressive movement
description: Pittsburgh-area progressives say their path to power is a roadmap for how left-wing activists can expand their coalition outside of the nation’s biggest cities.

title: 'Smallville' actor Allison Mack released from prison early after cult sex trafficking conviction
description: "Smallville" actor Allison Mack, who pleaded guilty for her role in a sex-trafficking case linked to cult-like group NXIVM, has been released from prison early, federal records suggest.

title: Multiple shark bites reported off New York coast in two days
description: Several shark encounters and sightings were reported this week, from the East Coast to the Gulf Coast.

title: What we know about the victims of the deadly Philadelphia shooting
description: Two of the five people killed in an apparently random shooting in Philadelphia on Monday night were remembered by their families as a man who would try to help anyone he could and a lovable teenager who died trying to get his wounded friend aid.

title: Federal judge restricts White House from contact with social media companies
description: A U.S. federal judge has blocked some of the agencies and officials of President Biden's administration from communicating with social media companies to moderate content. The ruling is in response to a lawsuit by two Republican attorney generals.
